I read alot of forum threads on this sound issue.  I had to go to Properties on my shortcut, click on Compatability - Tell it to Run as XP Service Pack 2, I also told it to Run as Administrator.  I'm using Windows 7 and this fixed it for me.

Asking for serial number Please Help!!!!!

It should not ask at all.

Be specific, exactly how are you launching the game?  Depending on how you extract with winrar you should have this series of folders:  Bioshock.PC.Game ...\2K games\2K games\Bioshock\Builds\Release\Bioshock.exe (in the Release Folder).

Click on that Bioshock.exe or make it a shortcut on your desktop, it won't ask for a serial number when you launch.

I found "A" solution to the empty safe bug.  I am pasting this from a forum post I found:

I HAVE FOUND A 100% WORKING SOLUTION!


After reading countless of solutions like tonics, not searching the bodies and searching the safe in the first place (none of them worked for anyone i guess...) i found my own way to fix this bug. Its not really a fix, but a detour.

When you enter the room that looks like an open area with trees and in which there is an event that some gas purs from the ceiling and the door at the right close (btw, the door that closes is the door with capsule that takes you to another level) you teleport behind the door before it closes, get on the capsule and go to another level, you will miss some of the items, but will know the story from the glitched level more or less, the safe bug was at the end i suppose, if not i will read some walktrough to see what happened after the safe glitch but that is not important now, if you want to play the next levels of the game you better read along:P now, you probably ask yourself how do you teleport? Just search bioshock cheat codes for Teleport to Pointer - teleport, the cheat codes are so simple that its just unbelivable. I turned on god mode and teleport. For lazy people, open defuser.ini from the release directory and at the top of the file you have default user settings, just find the F's shortcuts and on your preffered free one type "teleport" for example F10=teleport

PS: TURN OFF ALL THE CHEATS AFTER YOU GET PASS THE GLITCHED LEVEL! you will spoil a great game.

To those who have a problem with the sound after the plane scene and have Vista or Windows 7, try this:
Control panel>Hardware And Sound>Sound>right click inside white box and click show disabled devices>click the recording tab>right click the one thats disabled (stereo mix or CD audio both work) and enable it

If not, there's always the compatibility option

You don't need a serial, you just extract and play it. And while you're extracting do not surf on the internet or anything like that. It somehow messes the files up.

ATTENTION!

This torrent cannot be patched to 1.1 using the standard patch, which means you are very likely to get stuck in Arcadia, where a safe with a quest item will be empty.   I know of no way to put this item into your inventory manually.

There is a workaround:  find your user.ini file in /appdata/roaming/bioshock/ or equivalent.  Bind 'ghost' and 'walk' to two keys.  IE:  search for first occurence of "F11=" and change it to F11=ghost.  Then change the next line to F12=walk.  Use these keys to clip through doors to farmers market and metro station.  You will miss plot events in arcadia as a result.

Or...

I have patched this torrent to 1.1.

(I haven't played all the way through yet, but it boots as 1.1 and is running).

Extract this standalone torrent, then DL 1.1 patch and 1.1 no-cd.exe file.

Extract/install 1.1 upgrade/patch (I did it from within folder), delete and substitute new 1.1 cracked bioshock.exe/boot executable. 

Then REBOOT!

Then REBOOT!!!

I thought it had failed the first 2 times. 
It didn't boot from the cracked 1.1 exe, although it did boot from the original 1.0 exe. 
But it crashed after the postcards.

But I had not rebooted.

Extract the 1.1 patch alone as a zip and it has a text file inside that tells you to REBOOT.

REBOOT after installing the 1.1 up!

Seems to work.

Although you system is always a variable.

(I'm running this acceptably cranked down on a MSI wind 2X.)

"(I did it from within folder)"

From within the bioshock install folder.

I renamed and relocated mine.

But it seems to find the folder anyway.

I guess although this torrent is practically SA, it leaves a few keys behind.

(And a smidge of a securom dummy folder. But nothing unlocker doesn't kick out quick whenever you feel like it. It just regenerates when you run again.)

Okay never mind lol; figured out how to fix the no-sound-issue! Just follow these instructions (source: Leetsk33t):
'browse to Start > Control Panel > Sound (in classic view). Once done switch to the Recording tab which will show the currently active inputs on your system (e.g. Line in, Microphone). Right click in the clear space below these devices and select the option for Show disabled devices.
This should show an additional device called Stereo Mixing, right click on this device and select Enable.'
